article_text:
Parker, SD

Nestled on the edge of Parker, SD, the Turner County Fair is South Dakota's oldest fair, marking 135 years when it officially gets underway on Monday.

Packed into just four days, visitors can take in everything from 4-H exhibits to livestock shows, carnival rides and races in the Grand Stand, plus free musical acts on the Freedom Stage in Heritage Park.

Guests can also take a step back in time, walking through an old general store, millinery shop as well as a one-room schoolhouse and church. Parking and gate entry is free.

Visit the Turner Co. Fair website to purchase Grand Stand tickets, view a complete schedule and see a list of vendors.
